intro: Onoseris reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Onoseris reflexa is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
